title: The Banker
description: A banker representing a potential buyer comes to the Scranton branch to interview the H.R. department before the sale goes through.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Dunder Mifflin is about to be sold. But first an investment banker has to drop by and sign off on our branch. And... I'm... pretty nervous about it. And... I'm... making some cosmetic tweaks to help create a more appealing environment. Is that dishonest? Well, think of it this way:

quotes.speaker: Computron
quotes.text: [Dwight using a robotic voice over the PA system] Hello, Eric Ward. Welcome to Dunder Mifflin. I am Computron, your answer to everything.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [entering on a Segway Scooter] I see you've met Computron, our virtual helper. I'm Michael Scott. Welcome. Welcome. Computron is just one of the many modern devices that I have incorporated into the office. Watch this. Computron?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: What is the world's largest ocean?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Great news, Michael. We're now the official paper supplier of the NFL.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: That is fantastic. It's good, but it's not good enough. Keep working. And here's Pam. She's our international sales consultant.

quotes.speaker: Computron
quotes.text: The NFL celebrated its 50th anniversary in 1972.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: It might seem crazy, but since there's no one left in New York, Michael is Dunder Mifflin's highest ranking employee. So, that's where we are.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: For the record? Not on board with fake Stanley... although, I get it.

quotes.speaker: Eric
quotes.text: Uh, I just need to check out your warehouse and then talk to your HR guy. That is pretty much the only reason I'm here.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Ok. Well, I thought I'd show you around a little bit -

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: - since you made the trip out. And I got us reservations at Cooper's Seafood. You like lobster? You've had lobster before, right?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: They make the best Maine lobster in the world. You'll love it.

quotes.speaker: Computron
quotes.text: Mul Yam in Tel Aviv is better.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No, Computron, actually I think Cooper's is the best. You're gonna love it.

quotes.speaker: Eric
quotes.text: It's called 'due diligence'. Basically, I confirm inventory, take a head count, see if there are any HR liabilities. I'm a glorified fact checker. Actually, I am a fact checker.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Alright. Excuse me. [slides past Eric to close the door to Ryan's closet office before Eric can see Ryan in there] If you will -

quotes.speaker: Ryan
quotes.text: Michael, do you think I could get a space heater -

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: - follow me this way. I'll introduce you to the crack HR rep that you requested. I give you Toby Flenderson. Have fun, you two. [Toby's chair spins around to reveal Dwight filling in for Toby]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, we will. Have a seat. [Michael gives a pleased look then exits]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I left a copy of Best American Mystery Stories 1999 in Toby's favorite stall. So, yes, I think I bought us some time.

quotes.speaker: Eric
quotes.text: So, um, the manager, Michael Scott... is a bit of a character.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: He has more character in a single flake of his dandruff then you have in that entire snow bank on your shoulder. Wait, what was the question?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: What are, are you doing at my desk?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ignore him. He's the local lunatic.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Come on, Dwight. Get out of here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Dwight? Who is this Dwight? Oh! You mean Dwight Schrute, the company's top salesman and the creator of Computron. I wear many hats but the one I'm currently wearing is that of gracious host. [laughs] Welcome. [Dwight exits]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Sorry. Hey, Toby Flenderson. Nice to meet you. How can I help?

quotes.speaker: Eric
quotes.text: Um, are there any outstanding liability issues to be aware of?

quotes.speaker: Eric
quotes.text: Well, safety issues, injuries that could leave the company open to potential lawsuits.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Um... nothing comes to mind. [clip montage]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You know, uh, what does it mean to be happy. [shakes head] Keep philosophers busy for awhile.

quotes.speaker: Eric
quotes.text: What about non-safety issues, in terms of liability? Sexual harassment. Anything like that?

quotes.speaker: Eric
quotes.text: You're the head of Human Resources.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I don't know how I'm going to get through this. I don't want to lie and I DON'T want to tell the truth.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Hey, Tobes. Whatcha doin'? Whatcha guys talkin' about?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Well, Eric's just going over some stuff.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: HR stuff? [pulls up a chair] HR Pufnstuf. Right up my alley. [pointing to Eric's notes] What is that? What kind of stuff is that?

quotes.speaker: Eric
quotes.text: It's uh, it's a company evaluation form.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Waste? What does that even mean? Like garbage?

quotes.speaker: Eric
quotes.text: No, waste of time and resources.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Look, you know, in any company  there's going to be certain degrees -

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: No. No. No. No. No. No. Respectfully, Toby, no. No. This company does not waste time or resources, ever. [clip montage]

quotes.speaker: Eric
quotes.text: Is anyone near retirement age? [Michael and Toby look at each other - Creed clip montage]

quotes.speaker: Eric
quotes.text: [on the phone] Hey, uh, yeah, I finally got a chance to sit down with HR. So... well, I think I'm gonna be here for awhile.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: This is a building where friends become lovers and lovers become sexually interactive. [to Toby] Right? Would you agree with that?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Michael, this is really inappropriate to talk about.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [as Eric is being escorted out by Michael and Toby] Thank you, so much.

quotes.speaker: Eric
quotes.text: Thank you. It's nice to meet you all.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I feel very sorry for that banker because he has to evaluate what we are worth. He has to decide what we are capable of and how do you do that? What is Jim capable of... or Pam... or Kevin? [clip montage over Daryl's Dunder Mifflin jingle]

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: I don't care if he goes and files a report and says that we're nothing special because I think our future is very bright. We have only just begun.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Computron, I'm gonna pull your plug. Ok? Buddy?

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: [extended Lazy Scranton video] Sittin' in my office with a plate of grilled bacon. Called my man, Dwight, just to see what was shakin'.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yo, Mike, our town is dope and pretty.

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: So check out how we live

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: The Electric City. Lazy Scranton, the Electric City. They call it that 'cause of the electricity. The city's laid out from East to West and our public parks are libraries are truly the best. Call poison control if you're bitten by a spider.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But check that it's covered by your

quotes.speaker: Michael
quotes.text: Plenty of space in the parking lot.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: But the little cars go in the compact spot!
